image.altText: Woman in an Australia post high visibility top is sorting the mail and smiling

props.synopsis: A disability enterprise is partnering with Australia Post to deliver mail to Aboriginal town camps around Alice Springs.

title.children: Meet the Alice Springs disability enterprise delivering mail to town camps

image.altText: Steve Edgington wears a suit and tie while standing outside NT Parliament.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Health Minister Steve Edgington announces the withdrawal of public funding for puberty blockers and hormone treatments for children, labelling them "dangerous, ideologically driven practices".

title.children: NT government pulls funding for puberty blockers, hormones for kids

image.altText: A child wearing a bike helmet, smiling at the camera and pointing at the gap where his baby teeth have fallen out.

props.synopsis: An Alice Springs teenager who grew up with cycling program Bikes Mwerre is now sharing his knowledge with the next generation. It's a full-circle moment for the outback program built on pride, skills and belonging.

title.children: Outback bike program celebrates four years of teaching the next generation

image.altText: An airline's blue and red logo can be seen painted on the tail of a large commercial plane.

props.synopsis: Direct flights between Darwin and China have resumed for the first time since the COVID-19 pandemic, bringing optimism of a tourism boom for the two countries.

title.children: Direct Darwin to China flights take off for first time since pandemic

image.altText: Three for sale signs on a cul-de-sac in Darwin.

props.synopsis: First home buyers are being priced out of the Darwin property market by interstate investors looking to cash in on high rental yields, with many properties sold without even being listed.

title.children: Investors target high rental yields in booming Darwin housing market

image.altText: outside a big imposing white court house

props.synopsis: The NT coroner makes nine recommendations following an inquest into the deaths of two disabled Aboriginal brothers who spent a number of years homeless in Alice Springs.

title.children: Deaths of two Aboriginal brothers with disability reveals systemic failures

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and a beanie looks out from behind a steel fence.

props.synopsis: Despite US President Donald Trump's objections to the annexation of the West Bank, new settlement projects are still being approved. Some Israelis are excited, while Palestinians are left fearful.

title.children: 'This is annexation': Israel expands control over West Bank despite Trump's opposition

image.altText: Greenland lies at a strategic point between Russia and the USA.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump appoints a special envoy to Greenland, drawing renewed criticism from Denmark and the territory's leader over Washington's interest in the mineral-rich Arctic island.

title.children: Trump sparks Denmark's anger by appointing US envoy to Greenland

image.altText: Donald Trump puts a red 'Make America Great Again' baseball cap on his head.

props.synopsis: The release of the Epstein files followed some of Donald Trump's dedicated supporters launching a rare revolt against the US president. Here are six more issues that could also divide Republicans.

title.children: It's not just the Epstein files — these other issues are splitting Trump's base

image.altText: Overhead shot of a large aircraft carrier warship in the sea with fighter jets lining the deck.

props.synopsis: The Pentagon moved the USS Gerald R Ford, the world's largest aircraft carrier, to the Caribbean last month. Now, President Donald Trump is repeating threats of imminent strikes against Venezuelan territory.

title.children: World's largest warship looms near Venezuela as US warns of land attacks

image.altText: A middle aged man in a black jacket pictured at 'The Game Awards'.

props.synopsis: Vince Zampella has died after a crash on a scenic road north of Los Angeles, according to local broadcaster NBC4.

title.children: Call of Duty co-founder Vince Zampella reportedly killed in Ferrari crash

image.altText: Three puffin birds on a rock.

props.synopsis: The Isle of May is the epicentre of a deadly outbreak of the H5N1 bird flu strain which has spread throughout the globe. Scientists are warning Australia could be next.

title.children: Scientists warn deadly bird flu outbreak about to become reality for Australia

image.altText: A table with bars of gold on it inside a vault in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market opens up while the price of gold jumps to a fresh record. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Gold jumps to fresh record as Santa rally continues on share market

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Why did the RBA leave rates on hold in December?
DroneShield extends gains on measures to tackle governance issues

image.altText: A footballer waves his hand in the air while on the field, wearing a red and black striped jersey.

props.synopsis: A historic Serie A soccer clash between AC Milan and Como at Perth Stadium in February is called off, with sanctions imposed by the Asian Football Confederation blamed for making it "impossible".

title.children: Landmark Italian league game in Perth cancelled over 'unacceptable demands'

image.altText: A tent pitched near a river.

props.synopsis: Unattended caravans line a popular Murray River campsite, triggering debate over whether public camping spots are being quietly claimed ahead of the busy holiday season.

title.children: Unattended caravans 'ghost camping' at free sites spark debate over fair access

image.altText: A house with damage to its front entrance with a black Mercedes-Benz car parked in the front yard

props.synopsis: A Mount Gambier man is sentenced after hiring a crane and partially destroying another man's home.

title.children: Man who hired crane to attack another man's home gets home detention

image.altText: ACT Magistrate Court

props.synopsis: A failure to 'keep the King's Peace' and biting a police officer has almost landed a Canberra woman in jail for Christmas.

title.children: Woman fails to 'keep the King's Peace' before biting police officer's leg

image.altText: A satellite image of the tropical low

props.synopsis: Perth is expected to hit a high of 41 degrees on Christmas Day with the Cocos (Keeling) Islands bracing for a tropical cyclone that could intensify to a category two system.

title.children: Festive season to bring Perth heatwave, Indian Ocean cyclone

image.altText: Three men, shirtless, on stage dancing

props.synopsis: Once December rolls around, there's nothing the minor movie studios love more than getting their most unhinged Christmas tropes out of cold storage.

title.children: Quiz: Can you pick the real Christmas movies from these unhinged plots?

image.altText: A white car sits completely ruined after an explosion with three men standing at the back of it

props.synopsis: The Kremlin is probing who is behind the killing, which has similarities to previous attacks by Ukrainian special services.

title.children: Car bomb kills Russian army general in Moscow, officials say

image.altText: Three police officers stand in a cordoned off street with one pointing a light at the camera

props.synopsis: Police in Taiwan say Chang Wen purchased grenades, gas canisters and respirators in the year leading up to Friday's attack.

title.children: 'Extremely cunning': Taipei metro attacker planned assault for over a year

image.altText: A peeled lychee in a hand, held over a box of fresh lychees.

props.synopsis: After season constraints and rain-delayed harvests, this summer is producing exceptional Queensland lychees, according to the wholesalers.

title.children: Christmas lychees best quality in decades despite tough season

image.altText: Two giant sequoia trees in St David's Park, foreground tree very sick.

props.synopsis: An 88-year-young giant sequoia tree is "declining rapidly" in St David's Park in central Hobart due to a range of disturbances, including vandalism and fire, the council says.

title.children: Giant tree in Hobart park 'declining rapidly' following vandalism and fires

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt smiles outside his house which is swamped by Christmas lights

props.synopsis: Families from all over Adelaide visit Joe Ferraro's home to marvel at his Christmas display, which he has amassed a collection of more than 50,000 lights since he began nearly 20 years ago.

title.children: The Christmas display that charms kids, adults and nuns visiting on a minibus

image.altText: Blue ski boat racing on the a river with Superman logos

props.synopsis: One past Southern 80 winner and record holder wonders if the race will ever return.

title.children: Southern 80 water ski race cancelled for second year straight

image.altText: A man with long brown hair, a goatee and moustache wearing a turtleneck jumpber smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: The man best known for his festive hit Driving Home for Christmas died surrounded by his family.

title.children: British singer-songwriter Chris Rea dies aged 74

image.altText: a black 360 degree camera on a high tower

props.synopsis: The $9 million initiative covers black spots, scanning the landscape for changes that indicate a fire has ignited then alerting fire authorities.

title.children: High-tech early detection cameras in NSW are spotting fires before they spread

image.altText: Bonnie Deas holds the basketball in two hands while being defended by Sami Whitcomb in a WNBL game.

props.synopsis: Bonnie Deas is shining in US college basketball, and she puts a lot of her success down to a WNBL semifinal trial by fire against Australian basketball great Sami Whitcomb.

title.children: The trial by fire that gave Bonnie Deas a running start on the US college scene

image.altText: Aerial shot of massive oil and gas rig in the Bass Strait off Victoria

props.synopsis: The gas export industry has cost the nation dearly. East coast prices trebled soon after exports began.

title.children: Better late than never: The gas fix to a problem that should never have been

image.altText: Sunset picture of gold mine operations with mountain range in background

props.synopsis: One of the country's largest gold mines in the NSW Central West will buy five new dust monitors after incidents at its tailings dam.

title.children: Gold mine pays $330,000 after two dust incidents

image.altText: Rob standing with two of his horses, smiling

props.synopsis: The heavy rainfall is welcomed by graziers and follows months of dry conditions in the state's far-west, with hot temperatures and wind battering the land.

title.children: 'Amazing' early Christmas present for outback NSW graziers following rain

image.altText: woman wearing glasses in a striped shirt, smiling with a cabinet covered in photos and nicknacks in the background

props.synopsis: After giving to her community for decades, Barb's town is now working hard so people like her never have to leave for necessities.

title.children: Barb dedicated her life to The Rock. Now The Rock is returning the favour

image.altText: A long, skinny island sits flanked by ocean and is covered in trees and a few built structures

props.synopsis: Residents of the tiny Indonesian island of Pari, which risks being swallowed by rising seas, win the right to have their climate change case against cement giant Holcim heard in a Swiss court.

title.children: Swiss court to hear islanders' climate change case against cement giant

image.altText: Police forensics officers outside a house.

props.synopsis: A man died after he was stabbed during an altercation in Clyde, in Melbourne's south-east. Just hours later another man was fatally stabbed in Fitzroy.

title.children: Police investigate two fatal stabbings in Melbourne

image.altText: Two women in active wear pose in front of an orange and blue backdrop.

props.synopsis: Eight years ago, Swetha Subbiah was asked to run a single football session for a friend. She ended up starting a sporting movement, which now has 15,000 women and girls as members across Bengaluru, Mumbai, Hyderabad and Delhi.

title.children: The Sunday football session that sparked a sporting movement for Indian women
